amendment.description: Amendment expresses the sense of the Congress that States and local education agencies should maintain the rights and responsibilities of determining curriculum and assessments for elementary and secondary education.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 113-158 to express the sense of the Congress that States and local education agencies should maintain the rights and responsibilities of determining curriculum and assessments for elementary and secondary education.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Luetkemeyer amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 182 (Roll no. 368).

action.text: House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Luetkemeyer amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 182 (Roll no. 368).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A004) offered by Mr. Luetkemeyer.
